summary: REQ-1 (set emergency ownership reset code to "73024141" in backend/main.mo and preserve trap behavior for other codes) is not evidenced in the provided diff excerpt. The diff also includes changes not requested (project_state.json feature-request bookkeeping and backend authorization logic changes unrelated to the reset code).

missing_requirements.requirement: Update the backend emergency ownership reset authorization key so that calling emergencyResetOwnership only succeeds when the provided reset code equals "73024141" (and other codes trap with "Unauthorized: Invalid emergency reset code"), and the successful call sets currentOwner to null and ownershipClaimable to true.
missing_requirements.reason: In the provided truncated backend/main.mo diff excerpt, there is no visible emergencyResetOwnership function nor any constant/key being set to "73024141", and no evidence of the required success/trap behavior change.
evidence: backend/main.mo (truncated excerpt shows no emergencyResetOwnership or reset-code constant)

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated project tracking metadata for feature requests (AR-1/AR-2) and architectural notes in project_state.json.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asks for a backend constant change; it does not request updating project_state.json or adding feature-request metadata.

hallucinated_features.description: Changes to admin validation / authorization behavior (e.g., isValidAdmin only checks currentOwner with no fallback to AccessControl roles) and related authorization checks shown in backend/main.mo excerpt.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly limits scope to changing the emergency reset code value and says not to change the post-reset authorization model beyond the reset code value; the excerpt shows authorization-model changes unrelated to the reset code.
evidence: backend/main.mo (excerpt: isValidAdmin logic and comment about no fallback to AccessControl roles)
